revised_title: Transparence and Translucence of Surface Film in Polished Metals: Evidence from Microscopy and Spectroscopy
tldr: This study investigates the transparency and translucence of the surface film formed during the polishing of metals, particularly copper, using microscopy and spectroscopy techniques. The author demonstrates that the film covering the pits on the metal surface is transparent or highly translucent and that it can be carried across empty pits without any support from below.
